This part consists of four linear curves and one circular curve. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system using the defined Euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Sketch 1. Create a new face for the 2D sketch. 2. Draw the first linear curve starting at coordinates [0.0, 0.0] and ending at coordinates [0.75, 0.0]. This creates Line 1. 3. Draw the second linear curve starting at coordinates [0.75, 0.0] and ending at coordinates [0.75, 0.75]. This creates Line 2. 4. Draw the third linear curve starting at coordinates [0.75, 0.75] and ending at coordinates [0.0, 0.75]. This creates Line 3. 5. Draw the fourth linear curve starting at coordinates [0.0, 0.75] and ending at coordinates [0.0, 0.0]. This creates Line 4. 6. Create a circle centered at coordinates [0.375, 0.375], with a radius of 0.0562. This forms Circle 1. 7. Ensure that Loop 2 is closed by connecting the end point of Line 2 to the start point of Line 3, using Circle 1. Extrusion 1. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.75 units. 2. Set the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0 units. 3. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. 4. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model using the specified extrusion parameters. After completing these steps, you will have successfully constructed Part 1 of the CAD assembly, which is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a central hole. The dimensions of this part are: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.75 units</description>
